attributes.action: Have a general election due to the incompetence of the current government.
attributes.additional_details:
The government are still using the wrong model and treating the Covid19 virus in the same aspect as a flu virus, when it is a virus more similar to SARS.

They are also giving out advice which is not clear and precise and gives people the indication they dont know what to do. To back this up. Figures have shown since the uk was locked down Londons Covid19 cases have still risen where other have gone down. Yet London is in a tier lower than areas with a reduction in cases.
attributes.background: The UK public have a right to request that a new general election take place. This is due to the current incompetence of the handling of the Covid19 pandemic and the local lockdown measures in place which do not match up to the figures of cases displayed on their own website.

rejection.details:
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/314151

Further information

You can find out more about coronavirus and how you can protect yourself and others here:

www.gov.uk/coronavirus
https://www.nhs.uk/conditions/coronavirus-covid-19/

The Government has also created an online service to help you find out what you can do if you’re struggling because of coronavirus: https://www.gov.uk/find-coronavirus-support

You can read NHS tips to help if you are worried about coronavirus here: https://www.nhs.uk/oneyou/every-mind-matters/coronavirus-covid-19-anxiety-tips

You can read impartial analysis of the Government response to coronavirus and policy developments here: https://commonslibrary.parliament.uk/coronavirus/

You may also be interested to know that because of the large number of petitions that have been started in relation to coronavirus, the Petitions Committee has been questioning the Government about its response to the coronavirus outbreak.

Find out more: https://committees.parliament.uk/work/192/the-governments-response-to-coronavirus/
